intro: Avena loeflingiana, commonly known as the slender oat, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to the western United States and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Avena loeflingiana is often found in open areas such as slopes and gravelly soils, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
